alert.note: Alert for Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Big Horn and northwestern Sheridan Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 515 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of Medicine Wheel, or 36 miles west of Sheridan, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain will cause ponding of water on roadways and in low-lying areas. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Big Horn and northwestern Sheridan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn
